description: Pale green translucent jade, traces of clay
text: Two stylized dragons are symmetrically arranged at either end of the pendant, flanking a humanoid face with a serpentine body. This figure represents a spiritual deity, with the dragons serving as guardian figures. This was a very common design at the time for jade pendants, which were worn as jewelry that served as talismans to protective the wearer from evil and danger.
title: Pendant in the form of a man flanked by a pair of dragons
